001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.fitting;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
004import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
005import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
008
009import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
010
011public class ProjectiveFit2D implements LinearFit2D {
012        
013        private final RealMatrix A;             // the calculated transformation matrix
014        private final double err;               // the calculated error
015        
016        /**
017         * Constructor.
018         * Fits two sequences of 2D points using a projective transformation model.
019         * At least 4 point pairs are required. For 4 point pairs, the solution
020         * is an exact fit, otherwise a least-squares fit is found.
021         * @param P the source points
022         * @param Q the target points
023         */
024        public ProjectiveFit2D(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
025                checkSize(P, Q);
026                final int n = P.length;
027                
028                double[] ba = new double[2 * n];
029                double[][] Ma = new double[2 * n][];
030                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
031                        double px = P[i].getX();
032                        double py = P[i].getY();
033                        double qx = Q[i].getX();
034                        double qy = Q[i].getY();
035                        ba[2 * i + 0] = qx;
036                        ba[2 * i + 1] = qy;
037                        Ma[2 * i + 0] = new double[] { px, py, 1, 0, 0, 0, -qx * px, -qx * py };
038                        Ma[2 * i + 1] = new double[] { 0, 0, 0, px, py, 1, -qy * px, -qy * py };
039                }
040                
041                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Ma);
042                RealVector b = MatrixUtils.createRealVector(ba);
043                DecompositionSolver solver = new SingularValueDecomposition(M).getSolver();
044                RealVector h = solver.solve(b);
045                A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(3, 3);
046                A.setEntry(0, 0, h.getEntry(0));
047                A.setEntry(0, 1, h.getEntry(1));
048                A.setEntry(0, 2, h.getEntry(2));
049                A.setEntry(1, 0, h.getEntry(3));
050                A.setEntry(1, 1, h.getEntry(4));
051                A.setEntry(1, 2, h.getEntry(5));
052                A.setEntry(2, 0, h.getEntry(6));
053                A.setEntry(2, 1, h.getEntry(7));
054                A.setEntry(2, 2, 1.0);
055                
056                err = this.calculateError(P, Q, A);
057        }
058
059        @Override
060        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
061                return A.getData();
062        }
063
064        @Override
065        public double getError() {
066                return err;
067        }
068        
069        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
070        
071        protected static void checkSize(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
072                if (P.length < 4 || Q.length < 4) {
073                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least 4 point pairs are required to calculate this fit");
074                }
075        }
076
077}
